items.sentence: Tom opened the door and turned on the light.
Tom opened the drawer and took out a pencil.
Tom opened the fridge and took out the milk.
It would be a shame to break down this door.
It would take forever to explain everything.
Tom is babysitting Mary\'s children tonight.
She danced with him at the high school prom.
She earns half as much money as her husband.
She first met him at a conference in Boston.
She had no intention of quarreling with him.
You\'re the one who said you wanted to talk.
The hallway is slippery, so watch your step.
Tom looks like he\'s put on a little weight.
I don\'t think there\'s anything in the box.
Tom doesn\'t take very good care of his dog.
I\'m going to play tennis with Tom tomorrow.
I\'m going to stay in Boston for a few days.
I\'m having a wonderful time here in Boston.
I\'m interested in the history of Australia.
Don\'t you ever do anything other than read?
Is that the only reason you don\'t like Tom?
Tom didn\'t buy everything he needed to buy.
Tom didn\'t come here alone tonight, did he?
Tom didn\'t come home from school yesterday.
Tom didn\'t do what he promised he would do.
Tom didn\'t even offer Mary a cup of coffee.
Don\'t forget to put a stamp on your letter.
Tom said he needed my help, so I helped him.
Tom said he planned on doing that on Monday.
Tom said he thought Mary would be back soon.
Tom said he thought we might have a problem.
You can\'t drive now. You\'ve been drinking.
It\'s not as cold today as it was yesterday.
Try to answer as many questions as possible.
Try to estimate how much you spent on books.
Was Tom the one who taught you how to dance?
Was it raining this morning when you got up?
What Tom likes most is whiskey on the rocks.
What are you doing at school this afternoon?
What brand of dog food do you feed your dog?
What do you think I should pack for my trip?
Tom said jokingly that he was not very rich.
Tom said something funny and we all laughed.
I wouldn\'t tell Tom anything if I were you.
I\'d like to buy two 45-cent stamps, please.
I\'d like to send this package to Australia.
I\'d like to take a small trip this weekend.
Why do you put so much sugar in your coffee?
Tom said he didn\'t know how to play tennis.
I have the money that you\'re talking about.
